title.narrative: ENHANCED DEMAND AND PROMOTION OF HEALTH

description.narrative: Individuals, families and communities, especially from deprived provinces and other focus areas have the relevant knowledge, demand key Maternal, Neonatal, and Child Health (MNCH) services and appropriate behaviors, which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Maternal And Newborn Health, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved access and increased utilization of quality and equity focused Maternal, Neonatal, and Child Health (MNCH) and immunization services for mothers, new born, U5 children and adolescent girls in most deprived provinces and areas

sector.narrative: Community and home based maternal and newborn care
Facility based maternal and newborn care (including emergency obstetric and newborn care, quality improvement)
Maternal and newborn care policy advocacy, evidence generation, national / subnational capacity development
